phrase: Whitefly has used search order hijacking to run the loader Vcrodat.
adjacent_sentences: ['To date, Whitefly has atacked organizations in the healthcare, media, telecomunications, and enginering sectors.', 'How Whitefly compromises its victims htps:/w.symantec.com/blogs/threat-inteligence/whitefly-espionage-singapore 1/4 3/7/2019 Whitefly: Espionage Group has Singapore in Its Sights | Symantec Blogs Whitefly first infects its victims using a droper in the form of a malicious .exe or .dl file that is disguised as a document or image.', 'These files frequently purport to ofer information on job openings or apear to be documents sent from another organization operating in the same industry as the victim.', 'Given the nature of disguise, its highly likely that they are sent to the victim using spear-phishing emails.', 'If opened, the droper runs a loader known as Trojan.Vcrodat on the computer.', 'Whitefly has consistently used a technique known as search order hijacking to run Vcrodat.', 'This technique takes advantage of the fact that Windows does not require an aplication to provide a specific path for a DL that it wishes to load.', 'If no path is provided, Windows searches for the DL in specific locations on the computer in a pre-defined order.', 'Atackers can therefore give a malicious DL the same name as a legitimate DL but place it ahead of the legitimate version in the search order so that it wil be loaded when Windows searches for it.', 'Whitefly frequently delivers Vcrodat as a malicious DL that has the same name as DLs belonging to legitimate software from various security vendors.', 'The group leverages search order hijacking to asure that its malicious DLs wil be executed.']

Al rights reserved 23 Company General Use MALWARE TECHNICAL INSIGHT: TURLA Penquin_x64 T1032 Standard Adversaries may explicitly employ a known encryption algorithm to Cryptographic conceal comand and control trafic rather than relying on any Protocol inherent protections provided by a comunication protocol.', 'Despite the use of a secure algorithm, these implementations may be vulnerable to reverse enginering if necesary secret keys are encoded and/or generated within malware samples/configuration files.', 'T158 Hiden Files To prevent normal users from acidentaly changing special files on and Directories a system, most operating systems have the concept of a hiden file.', 'These files dont show up when a user browses the file system with a GUI or when using normal comands on the comand line.', 'Users must explicitly ask to show the hiden files either via a series of Graphical User Interface (GUI) prompts or with comand line switches (dir /a for Windows and ls a for Linux and macOS).', 'T12 File and File and directory permisions are comonly managed by Directory discretionary aces control lists (DACLs) specified by the file or Permisions directory owner.', 'File and directory DACL implementations may vary Modification by platform, but generaly explicitly designate which users/groups can perform which actions (ex: read, write, execute, etc.).']

phrase: JPIN can enumerate drives and their types.
adjacent_sentences: ['Security-related proceses avoided by the JPIN instaler Proces Security product 360tray.exe 360 Safeguard bdagent.exe BitDefender proguard.exe Proces Guard blackd.exe BlackICE blackice.exe BlackICE savservice.exe Sophos Anti-Virus avp.exe Kaspersky Anti-Virus rstray.exe Rising Anti-virus cmcore.exe CMC Antivirus cmctrayicon.exe CMC Antivirus zhudongfangyu.exe 360 Safeguard After instaling the backdor, the instaler deletes itself from the compromised computer.', 'PLATINUM uses at least thre distinct JPIN variants.', 'One variant typicaly runs with a mutex named hMSVm and instals itself in the folders %apdata%\\Com\\Jpin and %userprofile%\\ApData\\Resource\\Jpin.', 'After it is instaled and started, the JPIN service can perform the folowing tasks, among others: Obtain information about the computer, such as operating system version, user name, privileges, disk space, and so on.', 'List runing services, proceses, job IDs, and task IDs.', 'Enumerate drives and their types.', 'Enumerate registry keys.', 'Load a custom keyloger.', 'Download files.', 'Download and upgrade itself.', 'Acquire network information such as DNS, IP, proxies, and so on.']

phrase: MuddyWater has used malware that checked if the ProgramData folder had folders or files with the keywords "Kasper," "Panda," or "ESET."
adjacent_sentences: ['The upload comand downloads files from the CnC and saves them localy in C:\\ProgramData.', '6.', 'The clean comand destroys the victims disk drives C, D, E, F and then rebots.', '7.', 'The rebot and shutdown comands imediately rebot and shut down the victims machine.', 'In one version of the malware, the code checks if the ProgramData folder has folders or files with the keywords Kasper, Panda, or ESET.', '7/12 Victimology 8/12 Most victims of MudyWater were found in Jordan, Turkey, Iraq, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Afghanistan and Azerbaijan.', 'Other victims were also recorded in Rusia, Iran, Bahrain, Austria and Mali.', 'The malicious decoy documents used in the atacks sugest they are geopoliticaly motivated, targeting sensitive personel and organizations.', 'Atacker deception and atribution The deobfuscated PowerShel code used by the MudyWater group resembles previously sen PowerShel scripts that most likely served as prototypes.', 'Multiple documents used in the atacks also contain embeded paths from their authors machines.']

phrase: Chaes has used JavaScript and Node.Js information stealer script that exfiltrates data using the node process.
adjacent_sentences: ['In recent years, the LATAM cybercrime scene has evolved a great deal.', 'Some of the most notorious malware variants that have ben prominent in the region over the last year include Grandoreiro, Ursa and Astaroth.', 'LATAM cybercrime activities demonstrate unique features when it comes to TPs and how malware is propagated on an infected machine.', 'Some of the shared similarities include: Leveraging of .MSI files as an initial way to start the infection chain The use of Delphi as the prefered language to write malware Extensive use of LOLBins to execute content Downloading aditional legitimate tols to expand the malwares capabilities and for obfuscation When observing the shared behavior and mindset of LATAM-based threat actors, Cybereason researchers observed that the malware authors emphasize the ned to stay under the radar as much as posible, and prefer to use already-existing tols or legitimate software if it fits their neds.', 'FIGURE 1 Ful Atack Infographic Chaes: Novel Malware Targeting Latin American E-Comerce 2 Key Findings Targeting the Bigest E-Comerce Company in Latin America: Chaes specificaly targets the Brazilian website of e-comerce company MercadoLivre and its payment page MercadoPago to steal its customers financial information.', 'The final payload of Chaes is a Node.Js information stealer that exfiltrates data using the node proces.', 'Credential Stealing, Scren Capture, Browser Monitoring, Reconaisance: Chaes is designed to steal sensitive information from the browser such as login credentials, credit card numbers, and other financial information from MercadoLivre website customers.', 'Chaes also takes screnshots of the infected machine, hoks and monitors the Chrome web browser to colect user information from infected hosts.', 'Multistage Delivery, Multi-Language Malware: Chaes delivery consists of several stages that include use of LoLbins and other legitimate software, making it very chalenging to detect by traditional AV products.', 'Chaes also has multiple stages and is writen in several programing languages including Javascript, Vbscript, .NET , Delphi and Node.js Downloads Legitimate Software, Designed for Stealth: Chaes operates using legitimate tols such as Python, Unrar and Node.js, and Chaes stages consist of several techniques such as use of LoLbins, open source tols, fileles parts and legitimate node.js libraries designed to increase the malwares stealthines.', 'Under development: Cybereason observed new versions of Chaes, showing that the authors are improving the malware and ading more features FIGURE 1 Cybereason Anti-Malware Solution Detects and Prevents Chaes Chaes: Novel Malware Targeting Latin American E-Comerce 3 Threat Analysis Phase One: Initial Aces FIGURE 3 First stage of Deployment As with many traditional campaigns, this one begins by sending the victim a phishing email containing a .docx file.']

Desktop Protocol [T1021.01]).31 Kimsuky uses a document stealer module that changes the default program asociated with Hangul Word Procesor (HWP) documents (.hwp files) in the Registry (Event Trigered Execution: Change Default File Asociation [T1546.01]).', 'Kimsuky manipulates the default Registry seting to open a malicious program instead of the legitimate HWP program (HWP is a Korean word procesor).', 'The malware wil read and email the content from HWP documents before the legitimate HWP program ultimately opens the document.32 Kimsuky also targets Microsoft Ofice users by formating their documents in a .docx file rather than .hwp and wil tailor their macros acordingly.3 Kimsuky maintains aces to compromised domains by uploading actor-modified versions of open-source Hypertext Procesor (PHP)-based web shels; these web shels enable the APT actor to upload, download, and delete files and directories on the compromised domains (Server Software Component: Web Shel [T1505.03]).']

phrase: HTAs are standalone applications that execute using the same models and technologies of Internet Explorer, but outside of the browser.
adjacent_sentences: ['This is because proxy execution of malicious .hta files Mshta wil execute HTA content in files with any extension (or none at al) as long and Javascript or VBScript through as the file extension is not maped to a text/plain MIME type (e.g., Mshta wil not a trusted Windows utility.', 'There are execute a file with a .txt extension).', 'To further disguise Mshta execution, TA51 several examples of diferent types of renamed the binary in atempts to evade detection logic, which relied on Mshta threats leveraging mshta.exe during executing with its expected filename of mshta.exe.', 'initial compromise and for execution of code.', 'Mshta.exe is a utility that executes Microsoft HTML Aplications (HTA) files.', 'Detection HTAs are standalone aplications that execute using the same models and Colection requirements technologies of Internet Explorer, but outside of the browser.', 'Proces and comand-line monitoring Monitoring proces execution and comand-line parameters wil ofer defenders visibility into many behaviors asociated with malicious abuse of Mshta.', 'Similarly, proces lineage is also helpful for detecting adversary use of Mshta.', 'At a minimum, colect parent-child proces relationships, and, if posible, consider colecting information about grandparent relationships to.', 'Proces metadata We observed multiple adversaries this year renaming the Mshta binary to evade britle detection logic.', 'While we cover this extensively in our analysis of T1036.03: Rename System Utilities, binary metadata like internal proces names are an efective data source to determine the true identity of a given proces.']

phrase: NanHaiShu modifies the %regrun% Registry to point itself to an autostart mechanism.
adjacent_sentences: ['IMAGE 6: VBA MACRO DECODES AND EXECUTES THE JSCRIPT 6 NANHAISHU RATing the South China Sea In most of the samples, two sets of Base64 encoded files are embeded in the VBA macro.', 'For the recent sample, the VBA macro wil decode and first write JScript data to %apdata%\\Microsoft\\Network\\network.js, then execute it.', 'IMAGE 7: VBA MACRO DECODES & OPENS DECOY XLS FILE The macro then decodes a decoy XLS file, which it saves to the curent directory using the same filename as the malicious XLS.', 'The decoy is then loaded.', 'Finaly, the macro creates a VBScript file that wil delete the original file.', 'Meanwhile, the network.js modifies the %regrun% registry to point to itself as its autostart mechanism.', 'The code wil proced to retrieve the folowing system information (Image 8, next page) and upload it to the C&C server: 1.', 'Volume Serial Number 2.', 'IP Adres 3.', 'Computer Name 4.', 'User Name 5.']

phrase: NanHaiShu modifies the %regrun% Registry to point itself to an autostart mechanism.
adjacent_sentences: ['IMAGE 6: VBA MACRO DECODES AND EXECUTES THE JSCRIPT 6 NANHAISHU RATing the South China Sea In most of the samples, two sets of Base64 encoded files are embeded in the VBA macro.', 'For the recent sample, the VBA macro wil decode and first write JScript data to %apdata%\\Microsoft\\Network\\network.js, then execute it.', 'IMAGE 7: VBA MACRO DECODES & OPENS DECOY XLS FILE The macro then decodes a decoy XLS file, which it saves to the curent directory using the same filename as the malicious XLS.', 'The decoy is then loaded.', 'Finaly, the macro creates a VBScript file that wil delete the original file.', 'Meanwhile, the network.js modifies the %regrun% registry to point to itself as its autostart mechanism.', 'The code wil proced to retrieve the folowing system information (Image 8, next page) and upload it to the C&C server: 1.', 'Volume Serial Number 2.', 'IP Adres 3.', 'Computer Name 4.', 'User Name 5.']

phrase: They also manipulated scheduled tasks by updating an existing legitimate task to execute their tools and then returned the scheduled task to its original configuration.
adjacent_sentences: ['Lateral Movement Using Diferent Credentials 3/9 Once the atacker gained aces to the network with compromised credentials, they moved lateraly using multiple diferent credentials.', 'The credentials used for lateral movement were always diferent from those used for remote aces.', 'Detection Oportunity Organizations can use HXs LogonTracker module to graph al logon activity and analyze systems displaying a one-to- many relationship betwen source systems and acounts.', 'This wil uncover any single system authenticating to multiple systems with multiple acounts, a relatively uncomon ocurence during normal busines operations.', 'Temporary File Replacement and Temporary Task Modification The atacker used a temporary file replacement technique to remotely execute utilities: they replaced a legitimate utility with theirs, executed their payload, and then restored the legitimate original file.', 'They similarly manipulated scheduled tasks by updating an existing legitimate task to execute their tols and then returning the scheduled task to its original configuration.', 'They routinely removed their tols, including removing backdors once legitimate remote aces was achieved.', 'Detection Oportunity Defenders can examine logs for SMB sesions that show aces to legitimate directories and folow a delete-create- execute-delete-create patern in a short amount of time.', 'Aditionaly, defenders can monitor existing scheduled tasks for temporary updates, using frequency analysis to identify anomalous modification of tasks.', 'Tasks can also be monitored to watch for legitimate Windows tasks executing new or unknown binaries.', 'This campaigns post compromise activity was conducted with a high regard for operational security, in many cases leveraging dedicated infrastructure per intrusion.']

phrase: They also manipulated scheduled tasks by updating an existing legitimate task to execute their tools and then returned the scheduled task to its original configuration.

task-scheduling component of Windows, this technique alows adversarial persistence and execution behaviors to blend in with routine activity emanating from native tols and third-party CONFIRMED phrase: Adversaries can execute malicious content by interacting with or creating services either locally or remotely.
adjacent_sentences: ['His IT and security experience ranges from smal busineses to Fortune 50 organizations.', 'When not in front of a keyboard, hes often found trudging through the frozen tundra of the Uper Midwest, ocasionaly on horseback.', 'l 68 T105: Ingres Tol Transfer 2021 Threat Detection Report TECHNIQUE T1569 System Services #9 System Services ranks ninth this year thanks almost entirely to detections OVERAL RANK asociated with its Service Execution sub-technique.', '20.3% T1569.02 Service Execution ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED 19.2% 892 ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED CONFIRMED THREATS Adversaries use the Windows Service Manager to run comands or 909 instal or manipulate services, often with elevated privilege levels.', 'SE MORE > CONFIRMED THREATS T1569: SYSTEM SERVICES Adversaries may abuse system services or daemons to execute comands or programs.', 'Adversaries can execute malicious content by interacting with or creating services.', 'Many services are set to run at bot, which can aid in achieving persistence (Create or Modify System Proces), but adversaries can also abuse services for one- time or temporary execution.', '69 SEUQINHCET-BUS TNELAVERP l 69 T1569: System Services 2021 Threat Detection Report TECHNIQUE T1569.02 Service Execution #9 Adversaries use the Windows Service Manager to run comands or instal or PARENT TECHNIQUE RANK manipulate services, often with elevated privilege levels.', '19.2% Analysis ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED Why do adversaries use Service Execution?', '892 Al production operating systems have one thing in comon: a mechanism to run a program or service continuously.', 'On Windows, such a program is refered to as a service, and in the Unix/Linux world, such a program is often refered to CONFIRMED THREATS as a daemon.']

phrase: Many services are set to run at boot, which can aid in achieving persistence , but adversaries can also abuse services for one-time or temporary execution.
adjacent_sentences: ['When not in front of a keyboard, hes often found trudging through the frozen tundra of the Uper Midwest, ocasionaly on horseback.', 'l 68 T105: Ingres Tol Transfer 2021 Threat Detection Report TECHNIQUE T1569 System Services #9 System Services ranks ninth this year thanks almost entirely to detections OVERAL RANK asociated with its Service Execution sub-technique.', '20.3% T1569.02 Service Execution ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED 19.2% 892 ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED CONFIRMED THREATS Adversaries use the Windows Service Manager to run comands or 909 instal or manipulate services, often with elevated privilege levels.', 'SE MORE > CONFIRMED THREATS T1569: SYSTEM SERVICES Adversaries may abuse system services or daemons to execute comands or programs.', 'Adversaries can execute malicious content by interacting with or creating services.', 'Many services are set to run at bot, which can aid in achieving persistence (Create or Modify System Proces), but adversaries can also abuse services for one- time or temporary execution.', '69 SEUQINHCET-BUS TNELAVERP l 69 T1569: System Services 2021 Threat Detection Report TECHNIQUE T1569.02 Service Execution #9 Adversaries use the Windows Service Manager to run comands or instal or PARENT TECHNIQUE RANK manipulate services, often with elevated privilege levels.', '19.2% Analysis ORGANIZATIONS AFECTED Why do adversaries use Service Execution?', '892 Al production operating systems have one thing in comon: a mechanism to run a program or service continuously.', 'On Windows, such a program is refered to as a service, and in the Unix/Linux world, such a program is often refered to CONFIRMED THREATS as a daemon.', 'Regardles of what operating system youre using, being able to instal a program so it runs whenever the computer is on has an obvious apeal to adversaries.']

phrase: APT29 modified timestamps of backdoors to match legitimate Windows files.
adjacent_sentences: ['The timestamps are not set to arbitrary values, but rather copied over from default system files.', 'Considering that there are systems with modified and unmodified timestamps within the same incident, it can be asumed that timestamp modification is optional.', 'It apears that the copy target is selectable as the same malware would have the timestamps of diferent system files.', 'The team has confirmed that the timestamp modification technique done by the Lazarus group is also being used by other APT groups to hide their malware.', 'APT Group Description APT28 APT28 has performed timestomping on victim files.', 'APT29 modified timestamps of backdors to match legitimate Windows APT29 files.', 'APT32 has used scheduled task raw XML with a backdated timestamp of June 2, 2016.', 'The group has also set the creation time of the files APT32 droped by the second stage of the exploit to match the creation time of kernel32.dl.', 'Aditionaly, APT32 has used a random value to modify the timestamp of the file storing the clientID.', 'Chimera has used a Windows version of the Linux touch comand to Chimera modify the date and timestamp on DLs.', 'Kimsuky has manipulated timestamps for creation or compilation dates to Kimsuky defeat anti-forensics.']

phrase: Adversaries may breach or otherwise leverage organizations who have access to intended victims.
adjacent_sentences: ['Acesed May 13, 2020 at: htps:/atack.mitre.org/techniques/T193/ TLP: WHITE, ID#20206091030 1 TPs Spearphishing Link 1 Spearphishing with a link is a specific variant of spearphishing.', 'It is diferent from other forms of spearphishing in that it employs the use of links to download malware contained in email, instead of ataching malicious files to the email itself, to avoid defenses that may inspect email atachments.', 'Spearphishing via Service 2 Spearphishing via service is a specific variant of spearphishing.', 'It is diferent from other forms of spearphishing in that it employs the use of third party services rather than directly via enterprise email chanels.', 'Suply Chain Compromise 3 Suply chain compromise is the manipulation of products or product delivery mechanisms prior to receipt by a final consumer for the purpose of data or system compromise.', 'Trusted Relationship 4 Adversaries may breach or otherwise leverage organizations who have aces to intended victims.', 'Aces through trusted third party relationship exploits an existing conection that may not be protected or receives les scrutiny than standard mechanisms of gaining aces to a network.', '1 MITRE.', '(October 18, 2019).', 'SpearphishingLink.', 'Acesed May 13, 2020 at: htps:/atack.mitre.org/techniques/T192/ 2 MITRE.']
